## At a Glance

```bash
# Server â€” one-time setup
sudo openme init --server myserver.example.com
sudo openme add alice                           # prints client config
sudo openme serve

# Client
openme status                                   # health check
openme connect                                  # knock + optional post-hook
openme connect home                             # named profile
```

## Design Principles

openme is deliberately minimal in its attack surface:

- **One binary** â€” server daemon, client, and key management in one tool
- **No PKI** â€” keys are exchanged out-of-band (copy/paste or QR scan)
- **No open ports** â€” the knock port appears closed at all times
- **Modern cryptography** â€” Curve25519, ChaCha20-Poly1305, Ed25519
- **Forward secrecy** â€” ephemeral ECDH per knock; old captures cannot be decrypted later
